purpose.summary: This policy establishes the procedures for calculating and paying final sales compensation upon employee separation, including earned commissions, pipeline deal treatment, post-termination payment obligations, and clawback triggers. The policy ensures compliance with state final pay laws while protecting the Company's interests regarding outstanding obligations, recoverable draws, and post-termination deal crediting.
objectives: Define final commission calculation methodology for all separation types
Establish pipeline deal treatment rules for voluntary and involuntary terminations
Ensure compliance with state-specific final pay timing requirements
Set clear rules for post-termination commission payments on earned transactions
Define clawback triggers and recovery procedures specific to terminated employees
Provide consistent treatment across all separation scenarios

appliesTo: All voluntary resignations by commission-eligible employees
All involuntary terminations including performance-based and restructuring
Mutual separation agreements involving commissioned sales roles
Contract expiration for fixed-term sales positions
Death or permanent disability of commissioned employees
exclusions: Leave of absence (not a termination; see SCP-009)
Internal transfers between commission-eligible roles (see SCP-010)
Independent contractor terminations (governed by contractor agreement)

definitions.definition: The last day of active employment, which determines the cutoff for commission crediting, benefit eligibility, and final pay calculation. For resigned employees, this is the last day worked; for terminated employees, the effective date of termination.

Commission on transactions where all conditions precedent to payment (as defined in the commission agreement) were satisfied on or before the separation date, regardless of whether payment has been processed.

Commission on transactions that were in the representative's active pipeline (qualified opportunity or beyond) as of the separation date but have not yet closed. Pipeline commissions may or may not be payable depending on the stage and circumstances of separation.

A commission payment made after the separation date for transactions that close after termination but were substantially developed by the departed representative. Subject to specific eligibility rules based on separation type.

An event occurring before, at, or after termination that activates the Company's right to recover previously paid commissions per SCP-001, including deal cancellations, bad debt, fraud discovery, or violation of post-employment obligations.

provisions.title: Final Commission Calculation
provisions.content: Upon notification of employee separation, Sales Compensation initiates the final commission calculation process to ensure all earned compensation is identified, calculated, and paid within required timelines.

subProvisions.title: Calculation Scope
subProvisions.content: The final commission calculation includes all compensation elements earned through the separation date:
items: All commissions where the credit event occurred on or before the separation date
Pro-rated quarterly or annual bonuses based on attainment through the separation date
Accrued but unpaid SPIF or contest earnings through the separation date
Released holdback amounts where conditions were met by the separation date
Draw/guarantee amounts earned through the separation date (less any outstanding draw balance)

subProvisions.title: Calculation Timeline
subProvisions.content: Final commission calculations must be completed within the following timelines:
items: Standard commissions (easily calculable): Within 5 business days of separation date
Complex commissions (requiring data validation or customer confirmation): Within 15 business days
Annual bonuses or year-end true-ups: By March 15 of the following year (409A compliance)
Disputed amounts: Resolution timeline per SCP-015, with undisputed amounts paid on schedule
If state law requires earlier payment, the state deadline controls

subProvisions.title: Separation Type Impact on Calculation
subProvisions.content: The calculation methodology may vary based on the type of separation:
items: Voluntary resignation: Standard calculation; no additional amounts beyond earned commissions unless post-termination provisions apply
Involuntary termination (performance): Standard calculation; clawback review initiated for recent transactions
Involuntary termination (restructuring/RIF): Enhanced calculation; pipeline protection period applies
Retirement: Full calculation including any deferred amounts; pipeline protection per retirement agreement
Termination for cause: Standard calculation of earned amounts only; all unvested/contingent amounts forfeited; clawback review for prior 24 months

provisions.title: Pipeline Deal Treatment
provisions.content: The treatment of pipeline opportunities (deals not yet closed at separation) varies based on the representative's separation circumstances, the stage of the opportunity, and the representative's contribution to the deal.

subProvisions.title: Pipeline Credit by Separation Type
subProvisions.content: Pipeline deals are credited to departed representatives under the following conditions:
items: Voluntary resignation (standard notice): Deals at proposal stage or beyond that close within 30 days of separation: 100% credit; deals closing 31-60 days: 50% credit; beyond 60 days: 0% credit
Involuntary termination (restructuring): Deals at proposal stage or beyond that close within 90 days: 100% credit; deals closing 91-180 days: 50% credit
Termination for cause: No pipeline credit regardless of stage; all pending commissions subject to review
Retirement (planned): Deals at proposal stage or beyond that close within 180 days: 100% credit (per retirement agreement terms)
All pipeline credit is contingent on the departed representative not soliciting the customer for a competitor

subProvisions.title: Pipeline Stage Determination
subProvisions.content: The opportunity stage on the separation date determines pipeline credit eligibility:
items: Proposal/Quote submitted: Eligible for post-termination credit per the applicable timeline
Negotiation/Contract stage: Eligible at enhanced terms (longer timeline, higher percentages)
Discovery/Qualification stage: Generally not eligible for post-termination credit (insufficient deal development)
Closed-pending-paperwork: Treated as earned commission (not pipeline) if all material terms are agreed
Stage must be verified in CRM as of the separation date; post-separation stage changes are not considered

subProvisions.title: Non-Solicitation Impact
subProvisions.content: Post-termination pipeline credits are contingent on compliance with non-solicitation obligations:
items: Representative must not solicit or service the pipeline account for a competitor during the credit period
Violation of non-solicitation: Immediate forfeiture of all unpaid pipeline credits
Evidence of competitive solicitation: Customer or former colleague attestation, competitive intelligence, or market activity
The Company may require periodic certification of non-solicitation compliance as a condition of pipeline payment

provisions.title: Post-Termination Payment Obligations
provisions.content: The Company's obligation to make commission payments to former employees after separation, including timing, conditions, and communication requirements.

subProvisions.title: Payment Timing for Separated Employees
subProvisions.content: Post-termination commission payments follow these timelines:
items: Final pay (earned commissions): Paid per state law requirements (see state-specific deadlines below)
Pipeline deal credits: Paid on the regular commission payment schedule following deal closure
Annual bonus true-ups: Paid by March 15 of the following year per standard timeline
Holdback releases: Paid within 30 days of condition satisfaction, on the next regular payroll cycle
All post-termination payments made via the Company's standard payroll system or final pay process

subProvisions.title: State-Specific Final Pay Deadlines
subProvisions.content: Final pay including earned commissions must be delivered within state-mandated timelines:
items: California: Immediately upon involuntary termination; within 72 hours of voluntary resignation (or immediately with 72+ hours notice)
New York: Next regular payday following separation
Illinois: Next regular payday (or immediately if company has no set pay period)
Massachusetts: Day of termination (involuntary); next regular payday (voluntary)
Texas: Within 6 calendar days of termination
All other states: Follow the most restrictive applicable requirement; consult state law matrix

subProvisions.title: Communication with Former Employees
items: Separation compensation summary provided on or before the separation date
Monthly statements provided for any period with ongoing post-termination payment activity
Pipeline deal closure notifications within 10 business days of the credit event
Final payment confirmation letter when all post-termination obligations are complete
Contact information for compensation questions provided in the separation package

provisions.title: Clawback Triggers Upon Termination
provisions.content: Specific clawback considerations that arise in connection with employee termination, including pre-existing obligations and termination-triggered events.

subProvisions.title: Termination-Related Clawback Events
subProvisions.content: The following events may trigger clawback review in connection with termination:
items: Discovery of fraud, misrepresentation, or policy violations during exit review or after departure
Customer cancellations or deal reversals occurring within 90 days of the representative's termination
Bad debt on accounts managed by the departed representative (invoices unpaid >180 days)
Post-termination discovery of double-crediting or commission calculation errors benefiting the representative
Violation of non-compete, non-solicitation, or confidentiality agreements (if compensation was contingent on compliance)

subProvisions.title: Recovery from Terminated Employees
subProvisions.content: Recovery of overpaid or clawed-back amounts from former employees is subject to legal constraints:
items: Offset from final pay: Permitted only to the extent authorized by state law and prior written agreement
Offset from post-termination pipeline payments: Permitted; reduces future pipeline payments before disbursement
Outstanding draw balance: Recovered per SCP-008 and SCP-006 state law requirements
Direct demand for repayment: Written demand sent via certified mail with 30-day payment deadline
Legal action: May be pursued for amounts exceeding $5,000 after all other recovery methods are exhausted

provisions.title: Outstanding Obligations Offset
provisions.content: Before final compensation is paid, all outstanding obligations owed by the employee to the Company are evaluated for potential offset (subject to state law limitations).

subProvisions.title: Eligible Offsets
subProvisions.content: The following employee obligations may be offset from final compensation where legally permitted:
items: Outstanding recoverable draw balance (per SCP-008)
Previously identified commission overpayments with documented recovery agreement
Equipment or property not returned within 10 business days of separation (at depreciated value)
Unreimbursed corporate card balances or expense advances
Tuition reimbursement clawback amounts per the education assistance agreement

subProvisions.title: Offset Limitations
subProvisions.content: Legal and policy limitations on final pay offsets:
items: California: Offsets from final wages require prior written authorization; may not reduce below minimum wage
New York: Offsets limited to amounts specifically authorized in writing; cannot be unilateral
All states: May not offset earned wages below minimum wage for the final pay period
Disputed offsets: Undisputed compensation paid on schedule; disputed offset amounts handled through separate recovery process
Legal review required for any offset exceeding $5,000 or for California/New York employees

provisions.title: Separation Process and Responsibilities
provisions.content: A structured separation process ensures all compensation matters are properly handled and documented before and after the employee's departure.

subProvisions.title: Pre-Separation Checklist
subProvisions.content: Upon notification of separation, the following steps are initiated:
items: Sales Compensation notified within 24 hours of separation decision/notification
Pipeline snapshot taken from CRM as of notification date
Outstanding draw balance and holdback amounts calculated
Clawback exposure review for transactions within the past 12 months
Territory coverage plan developed for the representative's accounts
Final compensation estimate prepared and reviewed with HR and manager

subProvisions.title: Post-Separation Administration
subProvisions.content: Ongoing administrative responsibilities after the separation date:
items: Monitor pipeline deals for closure within the applicable credit window
Process post-termination payments on the regular commission schedule
Track holdback release conditions and process releases when conditions are met
Maintain separation file with all compensation-related documentation for 7 years
Update the terminated employee register for quarterly reporting to Compensation Review Board
Close the separated employee's compensation file when all post-termination obligations are fulfilled

federalLaws: FLSA (Fair Labor Standards Act) - final pay requirements
IRC Section 409A - timing of post-separation payments
ERISA - benefit continuation requirements upon termination
stateLaws: California Labor Code Sections 201-203 - Final pay timing and waiting time penalties
New York Labor Law Section 191 - Payment upon termination
Massachusetts Wage Act - Day of termination payment requirement
Illinois Wage Payment Act - Final pay timing
State-specific requirements for payroll deductions from final pay
